definition: classifier indicating a small amount or small number greater than 1: some, a few, several

sentences.english: One car went too fast and narrowly missed hitting another car.
sentences.chinese: 一輛汽車開得太快，險些兒撞上另一輛汽車。

sentences.english: She nearly fell down by stumbling over my stretched leg.
sentences.chinese: 她絆在我伸出的腿上，險些跌倒。

sentences.english: Emotional when the mirror will be almost blurted out the true identity of the Ming house.
sentences.chinese: 情緒激動之時，明鏡險些將明樓的真實身份脫口而出。

sentences.english: He received severe injuries and nearly lost his life during the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 在第二次世界大戰期間他身負重傷險些喪命。

sentences.english: In February she nearly died after eating a lightbulb.
sentences.chinese: 在今年2月份，她就因喫下燈泡險些喪命。

sentences.english: Betrayed by his friends, nearly to death.
sentences.chinese: 曾因同伴背叛險些喪命，後爲蠻幽王所救。

sentences.english: Almost none of them agreed to this arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 險些沒有人同意這種按排。

sentences.english: Blade regiment several times, but nearly will also save himself falling.
sentences.chinese: 刀鋒貪生怕死幾次撲救，卻險些也將本人墮入。

sentences.english: Giggs almost delivered a second outstanding goal midway through a far more open second half.
sentences.chinese: 在下半場中段，吉格斯險些再次打入一粒精彩入球。

sentences.english: He dived into the lake to save the drowning child.
sentences.chinese: 他跳入湖裏救出險些兒淹死的那個孩子。

sentences.english: She saved a lot of ants from getting stepped on.
sentences.chinese: 她還救了許多險些被踩死的螞蟻。

sentences.english: I was caught off balance by the sudden wind and nearly fell.
sentences.chinese: 突然一陣風吹得我東搖西晃險些倒。

sentences.english: His hesitation nearly cost him the chance.
sentences.chinese: 他的猶豫險些讓他錯過機會。

sentences.english: A boulder rolled down the slope and narrowly missed the car.
sentences.chinese: 一塊石頭從山上滾下，險些把車砸壞。

sentences.english: The car only just cleared (ie nearly hit) the gatepost .
He nearly fell down steep ravines several times in Vietnam and Laos.
sentences.chinese: 在越南和老撾，他有好幾次都險些墜入陡峭的峽谷。
